title: SoftBank struggles to raise another fund after WeWork's failed float
text:
SoftBank is reportedly struggling to raise the $108bn (£87.5bn) it had planned for its second Vision Fund following the failed float of WeWork, one of its largest investments.

The Japanese technology conglomerate announced its plans for a second technology fund in July, but has struggled to convince major investors to back the new fund, Reuters reported.

SoftBank’s original $100bn fund included $45bn of investment from Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund and $15bn from Abu Dhabi's Mubadala Investment.

Both backers are reportedly planning to make smaller investments in the second Vision Fund.

The only current significant commitment in the new fund is a $38bn pledge from SoftBank itself. However, that amount may also be reduced if the Vision Fund's parent company has a lack of available cash.

The struggle for SoftBank to raise the same level of funding comes after office space rental firm WeWork, which has received more than $7bn in funding from SoftBank, abandoned a plan to flat.
